Translations.Text: For the privilege (of security) cherished by Quraish
Enjoying their winter and summer caravans. (To Yemen and Syria respectively, that makes them affluent)
It infers, then, that they ought to serve the Lord of this House alone
Who has given them freedom from want, and has made them secure against fear. ('Ta'm' = Feeding = Taking care = Fulfilling needs = Freeing from want)
Have you seen him who proclaims allegiance to the Divine System, but denies it in action? ((53:33), (75:32-33), (95:7). 'Takzeeb' = Denying in practice
Behold, that is he who repels the orphan, the widow, the helpless, the one in a lonely state. (8)

And urges not the feeding of the needy. And participates not in helping those who have lost their jobs, whose businesses have stalled, and whose hard earned income is insufficient to meet their basic needs
Ah, woe unto the praying ones
They know not what their prayer is meant to be
They only want to be seen and praised. (9:54). (They go through motions of prayer and keep announcing it)
And, with all this, they put dams before the Spring of Sustenance. ('Ma'n' = Running water. 'Mu'in' = Source of sustenance with plenty of fresh water springs)
Behold, We have bestowed upon you Abundant Good. (The ever flowing stream of Wisdom and Knowledge in this Qur'an (13:35)

Therefore, follow the Commands of your Lord and convey them to others so that they might follow as well. And sacrifice your comfort for the welfare of the community. ('Sall' = Follow closely. 'Nahr' = Sacrifice = Sacrificing a camel = Sacrificing one's own comfort and resources for a noble cause)
Verily, it is your opponent that will be cutting himself off from the Abundant Good
